questions.description: Bacteria protect themselves from viruses by fragmenting viral DNA upon its entry with:
Restriction endonuclease hydrolyses polynucleotide from:

options.description: A phosphodiester bond within a specific sequence

questions.description: Restriction enzymes cut the strand of DNA a little away from the centre of the palindromic site, but between the same two bases on the opposite strands, these overhanging stretches formed on each strand are called.
Which of the following is considered as molecular glue?
If in a linear DNA, the sequence GAATTC appears at two sites. How many restriction fragments will result if we use EcoR I?
What is common to Hind II and EcoR I?
Each restriction endonuclease functions by inspecting the length of a DNA sequence. It cleaves:

options.description: Only the master strand to produce sticky end
Sense strand of DNA to produce sticky ends
Each of the two strands of the double helix at specific points in their sugar phosphate backbones

questions.description: Utilisation of living organisms/systems, processes for producing materials useful to human society is known as:
Nobel prize of 1978 for restriction endonuclease technology was given to:
The first restriction endonuclease was:
In the naming of restriction enzymes second two letters represents:

options.description: Order in which enzymes are isolated

questions.description: Which of the following is the example of chemical scissors?
Restriction endonucleases:

options.description: Are synthesised by bacteria as part of their defence mechanism
Are present in mammalian cells for degradation of DNA when the cell dies
Are used in genetic engineering for ligating two DNA molecules
Are used for in-vitro DNA synthesis

questions.description: The term "molecular scissors" generally refers to:
The stickiness of DNA ends facilitates the action of which enzyme:
Melting of DNA at 94°C is due to breakdown of:
Plasmids are suitable vectors for gene cloning because they:

options.description: Alter the pH of host chromosomal DNA
Are small circular DNA molecules with their own ori sequence

questions.description: Which of the following is not a vectorless method of gene transfer?

options.description: Chemical mediated method of gene transfer

questions.description: A multiple cloning site:

options.description: Contains many copies of a cloned gene
Allows flexibility in the choice of restriction enzymes for cloning
Allows flexibility in the choice of organism for cloning
Contains many copies of the restriction enzymes site of the same enzyme

questions.description: Blue–white selection is used to:

options.description: Test for the presence of a plasmid in bacteria
Reveal the identity of a cloned DNA fragment
Express the product of a cloned gene
Test the presence of a cloned insert in a plasmid

questions.description: If gene of interest is cloned at Pst I site in pBR322, the resulting recombinants:

options.description: Will not grow in presence of tetracycline

questions.description: In E. coli cloning vector pBR322, the restriction sites of antibiotic resistance gene, tetR are:
What could happen if a recombinant DNA is inserted within the coding sequence of an enzyme, β-galactosidase?

options.description: This will result in the inactivation of the enzyme
The presence of chromogenic substrate will give blue colored colonies
The recombinant colonies do not produce any color

questions.description: The term 'B' and 'R' in the name pBR322 represents which of the following?

options.description: Name of the restriction endonuclease enzymes
Name of the species of bacteria used
Name of the strain of bacteria used

questions.description: If the gene gun is used to transfer the gene of interest, the most suitable competent host must be:
Vector is the DNA segment used to carry the desired gene to another organism where it can replicate. To serve as vector, a DNA molecule must have following properties, except:

options.description: It must be able to replicate itself independently
It should contain several different RE sites
Each type of RE site should occur more than once
It should carry a selectable marker for screening the transformants

questions.description: In the process of recombinant DNA technology, the isolated foreign DNA is inserted into another DNA molecule known as:
Tumor inducing plasmid used in producing transgenic plants is that of:
How are transformants selected from non-transformants?

options.description: Presence of more than one recognition site in the vector DNA
Presence of alien DNA into the vector DNA results into insertional inactivation of selectable marker
Antibiotic resistance gene gets inactivated due to insertion of alien DNA

questions.description: Which of the following is not a characteristic of pBR322 vector?

options.description: It is the first artificial cloning vector constructed in 1977 by Bolivar and Rodriguez
It is the most widely used, versatile and can easily be manipulated vector
It has two antibiotic resistance genes, tetR and ampR
It does not have restriction site for Sal I

questions.description: The process to transfer the recombinant DNA into the host, cells are bombarded with high velocity microparticles of gold or tungsten coated with DNA, is known as:

options.description: Treatment with Ca⁺⁺ to make cells competent

questions.description: Extra chromosomal DNA used as vector in gene cloning is:
If the transformed bacterial cells are selected by blue/white screening, it means that the reporter enzyme/protein in this case is:
Which of the following pair is incorrect?

options.description: Plasmid – small piece of extra–chromosomal DNA in bacteria
Elution – removal of proteins digested by protease
Cosmid – a vector for carrying large DNA fragments into host cells

questions.description: During gene cloning, which is called 'gene taxi'?
Agrobacterium tumefaciens is used in genetic engineering for:
What is true for plasmid:

options.description: Plasmids are widely used in gene transfer
Plasmid contains gene for vital activities
These are main part of chromosome

questions.description: Which of the following is not true for cloning vector?

options.description: More than two origin sites of replication
Vector should have selectable marker gene
Single recognition site for the commonly used restriction enzyme

questions.description: If a recombinant DNA bearing gene for ampicillin resistance, transferred into E. Coli cells and the host cells are spread on agar plates containing ampicillin, then:

options.description: Both transformed and non-transformed recipient cells will die
Both transformed and non-transformed recipient cells will grow
Transformed recipient cells will grow and non-transformed recipient cells will die
Transformed recipient cells will die and non-transformed recipient cells will grow

questions.description: The gene of interest was cloned at BamH I site of pBR322. Which of the following is most likely to be one of the observations w.r.t. successful transformants?

options.description: Resistance for both ampicillin and tetracycline remain intact
The transformants remain resistant to ampicillin but are sensitive to tetracycline
Transformants are sensitive to both ampicillin and tetracycline
Transformants are resistant to tetracycline while sensitive to ampicillin

questions.description: Fragments of DNA formed after treatment with endonucleases like BamH I are separated by technique called :

PCR technique using Taq polymerase enables directly the ___a___ of billions of copies of an original piece of ____b____ in a tube within minutes. Select the option which fills the blanks (a and b) correctly?
Amplification of gene of interest by using PCR for 30 cycles may go up to :
Source of energy for polymerization in a PCR is :
Which of the following is an incorrect statement regarding DNA polymerase used in PCR?

options.description: It is Taq–polymerase isolated from Thermus aquaticus bacteria
Taq polymerase polymerizes DNA at 50–60°C in PCR
The DNA polymerase can only add new nucleotides to the 3'–OH end of the strand

questions.description: PCR is considered as a revolutionary technology because all of the following reasons, except :

options.description: It enables unlimited production of a DNA fragment in vitro
It is a highly sensitive technology
It enables the direct production of a synthetic gene that did not exist before

questions.description: There are three basic steps in genetically modifying an organism. Which of the following is wrong statement about the process?

options.description: Identification of the DNA with desirable genes
Cleaving DNA segments with 'ligase' and joining them with endonuclease
Introduction of the identified DNA into the host
Maintenance of introduced DNA in the host and transfer of DNA to its progeny

questions.description: You suspect your patient to be suffering from a bacterial disease, however the number of bacteria in the patient's body is very less. Which method can help you detect these pathogens in the laboratory?
Downstream processing in biotechnology refers to :

options.description: The process which includes separation and purification of the product, after the completion of the biosynthetic stage
Large scale production of a product, by using bioreactors
The cells harboring cloned genes of interest, being grown on a small scale
The microbes which act upon the substrate are cultured and added into the fermenter

questions.description: cDNA is :
Which statement about Thermus aquaticus is false?

options.description: The DNA polymerase from T. aquaticus is used in molecular biology for PCR
The DNA polymerase from T. aquaticus is able to withstand very high temperatures
T. aquaticus can survive at high temperatures and low pH
T. aquaticus is found in frozen lakes of Antarctica

questions.description: The polymerase chain reaction (PCR) is a powerful technique to :
Select incorrect match :
Choose the right combination of components required to set up a polymerase chain reaction (PCR) from the following:

options.description: Template DNA, two primers, dNTPs & DNA ligase
Template DNA, two primers, NTPs & DNA ligase
Template RNA, two primers, NTPs & Taq DNA polymerase
Template DNA, two primers, dNTPs & Taq DNA polymerase

questions.description: Thermostable enzyme which is utilized during amplification of DNA using PCR :
The first step in the PCR cycle requires :

options.description: Two primers complimentary to the ends of target DNA

questions.description: How many copies of DNA sample are produced in PCR technique after 6 cycles :
In gel electrophoresis, at which end of the gel the sample is loaded ?
Which of the following is not required in PCR :
Select the incorrect statement for continuous culture system :

options.description: In this, used medium is drained out from one side while fresh medium is added from the other side
In this, cells are maintained in their physiologically most active lag phase of growth
It shows higher yields of desired product

questions.description: In r-DNA technology or genetic engineering, elution means :

options.description: Removal of the DNA from centrifuge tube after centrifugation
The separated band of DNA are cut from the gel and extracted from the gel piece
Separation of the recombinant protein from recombinant cell
Insertion of recombinant DNA into the host cell

questions.description: The goal of the polymerase chain reaction is to :

options.description: Speed up protein synthesis for the production of new drugs
Create many copies of a DNA sequence which is initially very rare
Create many copies of messenger RNA molecules
Investigate the properties of organisms which normally grow at very high temperatures

questions.description: Microinjection of desired genes into fertilized eggs results in :
Choose the incorrect statement :

options.description: DNA fragments move towards cathode in electrophoresis
DNA containing gel can be stained with ethidium bromide
Smaller DNA fragments diffuse more rapidly through gel than larger ones
Electrophoresis is used to separate different pieces of DNA on the basis of their length

questions.description: Which of the following has been incorrectly matched ?

options.description: β-galactosidase - Encoded by Lac Y gene

questions.description: All the following statements about Stanley Cohen and Herbert Boyer are correct but one is wrong. Which one is wrong?

options.description: They discovered recombinant DNA (r–DNA) technology which marked the birth of modern biotechnology
They first produced, healthy sheep clone, a Finn Dorset lamb, Dolly, from the differentiated adult mammary cells
They invented genetic engineering by combining a piece of foreign DNA containing a gene from a bacterium with a bacterial (Salmonella) plasmid using the enzyme restriction endonuclease
They isolated the antibiotic resistance gene by cutting out a piece of DNA from a plasmid which was responsible for conferring antibiotic resistance

questions.description: Genetic engineering is possible because :

options.description: DNA can be cut at specific sites by endonucleases like DNase
Restriction endonucleases purified from bacteria can be used in-vitro
The phenomenon of transduction in bacteria is well understood
DNA can be seen by electron microscope

questions.description: Restriction enzymes :

options.description: Are endonucleases which cleave DNA at specific sites
Make DNA complementary to an existing DNA or RNA
Are required in vectorless direct gene transfer

questions.description: In EcoR I, what does 'I' part stand for :

options.description: Order in which enzymes were isolated from the strains of bacteria

questions.description: A bacterium modifies its DNA by adding methyl groups to the DNA, it does so to :

options.description: Be able to transcribe many genes simultaneously
Protect its DNA from its own restriction enzyme

questions.description: Absence of β-galactosidase activity in recombinant pUC8 is :

options.description: Observed in blue colonies with intact ampR gene
Observed in blue colonies with disrupted ampR gene
Observed in white colonies with intact ampR gene
Observed in white colonies with inactivated ampR gene

questions.description: If we want to recover more copies of target (desired) DNA then it should be cloned in a vector having :

options.description: An Ori which supports high copy number

questions.description: In which of the following scenario one cannot distinguish between recombinant and non-recombinant cell ?

options.description: When foreign DNA is inserted at Sal I recognition site in pBR322
In pBR322, a foreign DNA is inserted at Hind III recognition site
When recombinant pBR322 was created by inserting foreign DNA at Pvu I recognition site
Recombinant pBR322 which was introduced in cell carries foreign DNA at Pst I recognition site

questions.description: Plasmids are used in genetic engineering because they are :

options.description: Able to integrate with host chromosome
Able to replicate along with chromosomal DNA
May contain DNA sequences coding for drug resistance

questions.description: Which of the following enzymes catalyse the removal of nucleotides from the ends of DNA?
The transfer of genetic material from one bacterium to another through the mediation of a viral vector is termed as:
Which of the given statement is correct in the context of visualising DNA molecules separated by agarose gel electrophoresis?

options.description: DNA can be seen in visible light
DNA can be seen without staining in visible light
Ethidium bromide stained DNA can be seen in visible light
Ethidium bromide stained DNA can be seen under exposure to UV light

questions.description: 'Restriction' in Restriction enzyme refers to:

options.description: Cleaving of phosphodiester bond in DNA by the enzyme
Cutting of DNA at specific position only
Prevention of the multiplication of bacteriophage by the host bacteria

questions.description: Which of the following is not required in the preparation of a recombinant DNA molecule?
In agarose gel electrophoresis, DNA molecules are separated on the basis of their:
The most important feature in a plasmid to serve as a vector in gene cloning experiment is:

options.description: Presence of sites for restriction endonuclease

questions.description: While isolating DNA from bacteria, which of the following enzyme is not required?
Which of the following contributed in popularising the PCR (Polymerase Chain Reactions) technique?
An antibiotic resistance gene in a vector usually helps in the selection of:
Significance of 'heat shock' method in bacterial transformation is to facilitate:

options.description: Binding of DNA to the cell wall
Uptake of DNA through membrane transport proteins
Uptake of DNA through transient pores in the bacterial cell wall

questions.description: The role of DNA ligase in the construction of a recombinant DNA molecule is:

options.description: Formation of phosphodiester bond between two DNA fragments
Formation of hydrogen bonds between sticky ends of DNA fragments
Ligation of all purine and pyrimidine bases

questions.description: Which of the following organism is not a source of restriction endonuclease?
Which of the following steps are catalysed by Taq DNA polymerase in a PCR reaction?

options.description: Annealing of primers to template DNA
Extension of primer end on the template DNA

questions.description: A bacterial cell was transformed with a recombinant DNA molecule that was generated using a human gene. However, the transformed cells did not produce the desired protein. Reasons could be:

options.description: Human gene may have intron which bacteria cannot process
Amino acid codons for humans and bacteria are different
Human protein is formed but degraded by bacteria

questions.description: Which of the following should be chosen for best yield if one were to produce a recombinant protein in large amounts?

options.description: A stirred-tank bioreactor without inlets and outlets

questions.description: Who among the following was awarded the Nobel prize for the development of PCR technique?
Which of the following statements does not hold true for restriction enzyme?

options.description: It recognises a palindromic nucleotide sequence
It can produce the same kind of sticky ends in different DNA molecules
